conclusion: Calculate the electric field at point A due to charges 2q and -q.
Distance from 2q to A is L.
Electric field E1 due to 2q at A is E1 = k * 2q / L^2.
Direction of E1 is along the diagonal from (0,0,0) to (L, L, L) towards A.
Distance from -q to A is sqrt(2)L.
Electric field E2 due to -q at A is E2 = k * q / (2L^2).
Direction of E2 is along the diagonal from (L, L, L) to (L, L, 0) towards A.
Net electric field EA at A is EA = E1 + E2 = 5kq / (2L^2).
Midpoint O is at (L/2, L/2, L/2).
Distance from O to each charge is sqrt(3)L/2.
Electric field at O due to 2q and -q is given as E.
Assume given E at O affects magnitude at A.
Magnitude of electric field at A is EA = E / sqrt(3).
